[Portrait]Delita
[Dialog]You've not touched your supper. A
princess cannot live on pride alone.{END}

[Portrait]Ovelia
[Dialog]...{END}

Do you think to starve yourself?
None would weep, you know.

There are many who would be
gladdened by your passing. Stop
being stubborn and eat.{END}

You were in league with the cardinal
all along, weren't you?

What do you mean to do with me?
If you'd not give me over to Larg,
then what is your intent?{END}

To put you where you truly ought
to be.{END}

So, you would manipulate me as well.


I'll not do it, you know. I'll not bend
to your whims.{END}

You will. If you wish to survive,
you have no other choice.{END}

What do you mean?{END}

I mean-{END}

[Portrait]Knight
[Dialog]So, this is Lady Ovelia...{END}

[Portrait]Cardinal Delacroix
[Dialog]Do your spirits find you well,
Your Highness?
If you would be but a tad more tame,
there would be no reason to keep
you in so cheerless a place as this.{END}

[Portrait]Knight
[Dialog]These seem lavish enough quarters
for a false princess.{END}

Ho ho ho... The girl does not yet know,
Lord Folmarv.{END}

[Portrait]Folmarv
[Dialog]Truly? How pitiable.{END}

Tell me of what it is you speak!{END}

Very well.


You are not Ovelia Atkascha.{END}

What...?{END}

The true princess died years ago.
You are her double.{END}

That's absurd!{END}

It is neither absurd nor untrue. You are -not-
Ovelia.

You are a straw doll placed in an empty crib
by Council members who bear no love for
the queen.
It was their intent that you would someday
succeed the throne and relieve Queen
Louveria of her power.
They placed you in the royal family after
assassinating the queen's two eldest sons,
attributing their deaths to malady.
The deception was complete, and your ascent
all but sealed. King Ondoria was sickly, and
seemed unlike to father another son.
But against all odds, another prince was
born. Whether he is in truth of Ondoria's
seed is highly suspect, of course.
Like as not, Duke Larg found some other
sire to ensure his sister's place as mother
to the king.
Regardless, all of the Council's work was
made for naught the moment Prince Orinus
drew his first breath.{END}

You speak false! I'll not believe you!{END}

Believe what you like, child. It is of little
enough consequence.

You may be born a butcher's daughter
for all it concerns us.

We hold a trump card in our hands. The
stock from which it was cut matters not.{END}

What is it you wish of me, then?
What would you have me do?{END}

Naught at all, sweet child. We only wish
that you be our princess, as you always
have.{END}

I am a daughter of House Atkascha!
I'll take no orders from you!{END}

Oh? Then what will you do? Let yourself
fall into Duke Larg's hands, and you'll have
a noose in place of a crown.
We only wish to help you claim the throne
that is yours by right.{END}

...Who -are- you?{END}

We are no friends of Duke Larg, nor
do we sit in Goltanna's camp.

Think of us simply as...allies.{END}

Lord Folmarv, let us leave our
princess to collect her thoughts.

When she comes to see the reality
of her situation, she will doubtless
wish to be our ally as well.{END}

Indeed, let us give her
time to stew.{END}

Come, Delita!{END}
